YPM 208 (MTC; holotype of Ammosaurus major; referred to Anchisaurus polyzelus most recently by Yates 2010); Galton 1973
BP/1/4952 (R. J. Butler pers. comm. 18 Nov 2011); association of material may be questionable (McPhee et al. 2014); Yates & Kitching 2003
D. Parsons pers. comm. 30 May 2012 (femoral circumference); Galton 1998b; BMNH R2870-R2874, R2876-R2878, vertebrate, ribs, pelvis, hindlimb
BP/1/ 6234 (R. J. Butler pers. comm., 18 Nov 2011); Yates 2007; all four specimens lack the humerus; Yates 2007 reported ml shaft diameter = 92 mm, ap diameter = 83 mm in the holotype (TM 119)
Buffetaut et al. 2000; CH4; femoral shaft dimensions measured from figure
Yadagiri 1988; Yadagiri 2001 mentioned larger elements (FL =1390; HL=850), but did not provide more complete measurements
Kutty et al. 2007; ISI R257 (holotype, largest individual, and only individual with humeri and femora)
Pol & Powell 2007; PVL 4822; 4822 ? 53 (humerus, possibly of smaller individual); PVL 4822 ? 64, 4822 ? 65 (femora); measured from figures and PDM (PVL 4822/65, /53)
Cabreira et al 2011; femoral circumference provided by S. Cabreira, pers. comm. 13 April 2012
Haughton 1924; SAM 3342 (largest humerus); SAM 3602 (largest femur; shaft width measured from figure)

HMN Skelett 45 (MTC); Moser 2004; largest BSP femur (BSP 1962 I 153, PQ XL B), larger, but possibly not associated, femur and humerus on display at Tubingen (Klein, PhD thesis, 2004); MTC data also contains many measurements
MB RVL 1 individual (PDM: MBR 4718.99 [femur] and 4718.39 [humerus]); Galton 2001
Rowe et al. 2010; TMM 43646-2, measured from figures
Langer et al. 1999, 2007; Langer 2003; MUCP-PV 3844 (type), measured from figures; femoral circumference M.C.S.K. Malabarba pers. comm. 13 April 2012

Humeral circumference from R. Allain, pers. comm. 26 Mar. 2012; Allain & Aquesbi 2008;femur from 'specimen 8' (To1-381) of Peyer & Allain (2010), humerus and ulna from 'specimen 4' (Pt1) (adult referred specimen 'MNHN Pt1', slightly larger than holotype individual); body mass stated as 'around 8 metric tonnes' based on Anderson et al. 1985 (Peyer & Allain 2010)

YXV8702, paratype (PDM); Bai et al. 1990; paratype represents a larger individual than the type and so is used here (YXV8702, paratype), postcranial skeleton only briefly described, lacking figures and measurements
Young 1942; IVPP V20 (holotype skeleton); a larger femur ('V32t') has FL=460, midshaft width=68
MNA V2623; MCZ 9175 (cast of type, MNA V2623); Rowe 1989
Martinez et al. 2011; PVSJ 562; "highly crushed" (S. brusatte, pers. comm. 5 December 2011)- so estimated from Eoraptor
Bonaparte et al. 1999; Langer et al. 2011; MCN-PV 2355; UFRGS PV0725T (larger specimen-used measurements)
